perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall produce the products described on Schedule A and Schedule A-1 attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the "Products," each individual unit of Product "Unit"), for Premier at [***] Heritage's or Heritage's wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper's facilities (the "Facilities"). [***], except that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, [***].
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage shall produce the products for Premier at [***] Heritage's or Heritage's wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper's facilities (the "Facilities"). [***], except that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, [***].
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Schedule A and A-1 from the beginning of Section 2(a), the contract now lacks a clear specification of which products Heritage is obligated to produce. However, section 3(a) still references "the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products." This creates a contradiction because the primary schedules defining the Products are removed but the manufacturing process is still related to schedule C and C-1.

perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***].
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage shall purchase ingredients and packaging materials to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***].
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Schedules C and C-1 in Section 3(a), the section now lacks clear guidance on what defines the ingredients and packaging materials that Heritage is required to purchase. However, section 2(o)(i) states "All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered by Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A and/or Schedule A-1, which Schedules may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the "Specifications")." As such, the removal of the reference in 3(a) is a contradiction, because 2(o)(i) requires adherance to schedules A and A-1.

perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall charge Premier [***] as set forth in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-1.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Schedules C and C-1 in Section 3(b), the section lacks clear pricing schedule. However, schedule A-1 (created in section 5) has pricing, which has been removed from this section. This creates a contradiction, as section 5's explicit schedule no longer has a direct correlation to the payment terms laid out in section 3.
